title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says several spells of showers will occur in Northern and Eastern provinces.

title: CEB to submit revised electricity tariff proposal to PUCSL today
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) has announced that it will submit its proposal for the revision of electricity tariffs to the Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) today (06).

title: Digital economy to generate USD 15 billion revenue in five years – President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake emphasized the need for the support of all professionals to digitize the country and actively participate in the process, at a time when the expectations of the political establishment and digital technologists are aligned.

title: Sri Lanka Customs confident of achieving tax revenue target
byline: Sri Lanka Customs has expressed confidence in achieving the tax revenue target of Rs. 1.53 trillion for the year before December 31.

title: 2024 General Election: Deadline to submit expense reports ends today
byline: The Election Commission has announced that the deadline for submitting expense reports related to the 2024 Parliamentary Election will end at midnight today (06).

title: World Bank wins pledges for $100 billion replenishment of fund for poorest countries
byline: Donor countries have pledged a record $100 billion three-year replenishment of the World Bank’s fund for the poorest nations, providing a vital lifeline for their struggles against crushing debts, climate disasters, inflation and conflict.

title: Youth arrested for defrauding money via social media scam
byline: The Computer Crime Investigation Division’s North Western Province Unit has arrested a 22-year-old suspect from Digana in connection with an incident of defrauding money.

title: Parliamentary debate on Vote on Account continues for second day
byline: The parliamentary session commenced at 09:30 a.m. today (06), chaired by Speaker Ashoka Ranwala.

title: Sri Lanka to develop new nation branding tourism strategy
byline: Sri Lankan authorities are bringing together all stakeholders in tourism at a conference in January to finalise a nation branding strategy to propel the industry which is enjoying a period of growth, officials said.

title: Sri Lankan Buddhist monk to study at Oxford after 105 years
byline: Venerable Wadigala Samitharathana Thero has become the first Sri Lankan Buddhist monk to study at Britain’s prestigious University of Oxford in 105 years.

title: No political favoritism in granting new investment opportunities - President to BOI officials
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake stated that with the political stability that has prevailed in the country today, an environment suitable for investment has been created.

title: ‘Wicked’ named best film, Daniel Craig best actor by National Board of Review
byline: The National Board of Review put its full support behind Jon M. Chu’s “Wicked,” naming the lavish musical the best film of the year, Chu best director and awarding its stars, Cynthia Erivo and Ariana Grande, a prize for their collaboration, in awards announced Wednesday.

title: Bitcoin surges above $100,000 for the first time
byline: Bitcoin hit $100,000 for the first time on Wednesday, surging to a new record after President-elect Donald Trump unveiled administration picks seen as holding the keys to ushering in crypto-friendly policies when he takes office in January.

title: Fire extinguished at hotel in Colombo Fort
byline: The fire that broke out in a hotel in the Colombo Fort area has been completely extinguished, according to the Colombo Fire Brigade.

title: France’s Macron seeks new prime minister as Barnier resigns
byline: French President Emmanuel Macron met allies and parliament leaders on Thursday as he sought to swiftly appoint a new prime minister to replace Michel Barnier, who officially resigned a day after opposition lawmakers voted to topple his government.

title: President assures media freedom will not be compromised or restricted in any way
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake emphasized that he regards the media not as outsiders but as an integral part of the effort to build a better state and improve the lives of all citizens.
